titleStmt.title: A draught of the Cherokee Country, / taken by Henry Timberlake: a machine-readable transcription

availability.p: This work is the property of the McClung Museum, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: A draught of the Cherokee Country, / taken by Henry Timberlake
bibl.note: This is a (1974 ?) facsimile of a map, originally drawn in 1762 by British army officer Henry Timberlake, depicting the Overhill Cherokee villages in the lower Little Tennessee River Valley. This map shows the villages of Toskegee [Tuskeegee], Tomotley [Tomotley], and Settaco [Citico], which were among the 60 Cherokee settlements in the Southeastern states during the 18th century. Lieutenant Timberlake went to the village of Chota, considered to be the capital of the Cherokee settlements, in 1761 to explain the provisions of a peace treaty with the colonists after the siege of Fort Loudoun. Timberlake lived among the Cherokees for a year and visited many of the Overhill villages.
Frank H. McClung Museum Photographic Collection

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with Microsoft Word spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points

figure.figDesc: Timberlake Map. Time: 1762, shows Overhill Cherokee villages in the Lower Little Tennessee River Valley. Timberlake was a British army officer who lived among the Cherokee 1760-61, following the Cherokee war of 1759-1760 (siege of Fort Loudoun). This map is published in Henry Timberlake, 1765, Lt. Henry Timberlake's Memoirs 1756-1765, edited by Samuel C. Williams, various versions 1927, 1948. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.
Detail of Timberlake map of Cherokee sites in Lower Little Tennessee River Valley, shows area between Citico (Settacco) and Toqua. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.
Detail of Timberlake map of Cherokee sites in Lower Little Tennessee River Valley shows area between Mialoquo and Toqua. This information was provided by the Frank H. McClung Museum.

div.note: This document consists of three images only.
